item.title: Building Kingdom Movementum
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 workshop, Neil Cole looks at the dynamics of what Neil calls Movementum--exponential growth that births movement. We will examine how it gets started and builds as well as the ways it is easily prevented in the earlier stages but cannot be easily quenched in later phases.

item.title: The Future of Church Strategy
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 workshop, David Saathoff addresses the future of church strategy. Every church operates in one of three strategies; "More is more," "less is more," and "to be is more." Learn not only how strategies are shifting over time, but the most important insight behind any ministry design as you lead your way into the future. David Saathoff is the Lead Pastor at Bandera Road City Church - a church with 6,000 in attendance that he planted 18 years ago.

item.title: Social Media for the Rest of Us
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 podcast, Justin Wise speaks on social media. Author Clay Shirky says that we are a people "looking for a mouse." As a society, we've come to expect interactivity in all that we do. What, then, do we do with a culture that expects interaction even while at church? In this session, we'll look at the "why?" and the "how?" of the social web. We'll look at how you can build interactive communal experiences into the lifeblood of your church. We'll demystify social media and see how we can harness the power of these new communication tools for the sake of the gospel. It's social media for the rest of us.

item.description: In this Exponential 2011 podcast, Larry Osborne tells how every ministry has a team, but it's the stark differences in core values and practices that cause some to win while others lose. Discover what makes healthy and winning teams different.

item.title: Digital Alternatives to Traditional Communication
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 podcast, Kem Meyer shows how the Web transferred control from organizations to individuals and now people have more access to information - and to each other. How do we appeal to the sense of power & entitlement in our society without compromising Biblical values? What ar the new principles of communication that can help keep lines untangled - making it easy for people to find, contribute and share information without bottleneck, administrative overhead or destructive campaigning? This topic isn't breaking news; the Blogosphere is 12 yrs old, Facebook is 7 and YouTube if 5! Yet church leaders are still fearful that digital & social networks are a substitute for real relationships & convinced content control is an effective strategy. There's so much advice out there and nobody's an expert (don't believe anyone who tells you they are). There's no one-size-fits-all approach for anyone. However, everyone - regardless of skill, style or philosophy - can lead, leverage & influence if they're aware of a few basics of survival online & off.

item.title: Finding Your Focus
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 podcast, Tony Morgan shows you how, whether you know it or not, your church is probably bowing down to the perceived power of the "giant inflatable blue monkey." It's impacting how you define and communicate your discipleship strategy. It's impacting how you promote what's happening at your church. And, it's impeding your ability to help people take their next steps toward Christ. I will help you discover a few simple strategies to deflate the giant blue monkeys lurking in your ministry.

item.title: True Apprenticeship Today
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 podcast, John Worcester asks how we effectively apprentice church planters? How about trying the master plan Jesus used for training the 12 apostles? We must start developing more qualified apostolic type leaders in our local churches. These starter types need to gather teams and be urgently sent to preach the gospel and plant healthy churches in every place and for every people. Examine how Paul followed Jesus's model, and how churches today can raise up fruitful church planters from the harvest for the harvest. This is not easy, but it is more doable than is commonly envisioned. Discover practical ways to prepare yourself, family, partners, and plans for a healthy church start. Develop wise strategies for winning the lost, and equipping an initial core of ordinary, messed up people with blind spots just like you. What must be accomplished in the first several months of a church plant? How do you best use your time and money early on? How you start out will greatly impact where you end up.

item.title: Nomad Churches
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 podcast, Bill Easum speaks on nomad churches. Studies are showing church plants are spending more and more time in rented facilities before securing permanent property. This workshop, based on extensive research, examines tried and proven ways for church plants to flourish in rented facilities.

item.title: Branding, Marketing, & The Church 201: What's Next?
item.description: Though the Branding, Marketing, and the Church 101 seminar is NOT a required prerequisite for 201, this workshop will be less about how to think about branding and marketing in general and more of a practical, hands on workshop design to help you analyze your specific external (and internal) communications more intentionally. In this Exponential 2011 podcast, Patrick Dennis will talk through questions to help you evaluate your own brand if you have established one, or to build a foundation for your new brand if you are planting or rebranding a church. Come with paper and pen, and rolled up sleeves, ready to work.

item.title: Establishing Your Leadership
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 podcast, Brian Bloye instructs you on establishing your leadership. It is inevitable. At some point, your leadership will be questioned. Well-meaning people will test your boundaries. The mundane details of ministry will take over your 'to do' list. In this breakout, Brian will share the importance of creating a strategic, intentional plan for establishing your role as a leader.

item.title: What You Should And Can Do to Reach the Immigrants Among Us
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 podcast, Alex Mandes speaks on what you should and can do to reach the immigrants among us. At the time of Christ, the immigrant Samaritans were held in low regard and disdained by many of the Jews in Judea, among whom they were living. Likewise, many today in the U.S. have similar feelings for the immigrants among us, the Samericans. According to the Census Bureau, though, they are not only here to stay but are also part of the future Majority-Minority make-up of this country. Indeed, the time has come to reach them with intentionality! But how can we do so? How can we evangelize and discipline them beyond race and class distinctions? And how will we entrust the church to them in the future? Come learn from this lively, informative discussion.

item.title: Rythms: Equipping Ordinary People for Gospel Intentionality
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 podcast, Jeff Vanderstelt shows that in order to shape a Gospel Centered people, we must equip people to live ordinary life with Gospel Intentionality. In this workshop, we will identify the normal rhythms of life and work through how to equip normal people to live extraordinary on mission in these rhythms.

item.title: Embracing a Dangerous Mission
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 podcast, JR Woodward reminds us that Jesus calls us to following him into the world, which makes for an adventurous life filled with risks and rewards, joys and dangers. Part of the reason many young people are leaving the church today is because the church feels more like a country club rather than a community on a dangerous mission to bless the world. If we really want to follow Jesus, we must be willing to be rejected, to live simply, to be peacemakers and agents of economic justice, and ultimately be willing to suffer and die for his name's sake.

item.title: The Leadership Stool
item.description: What if you could find a leadership development model that was simple, yet deep; flexible and accessible by both pastoral and lay leaders and strongly connected to Scripture the way Jesus led? In this Exponential 2011 podcast, Dave Olson teaches about the Leadership Development tool - a simple, yet powerful model for pastoral development, staff and lay ministry development. It takes 5-10 minutes to complete online, and is based on the example of Jesus.

item.title: On the Verge
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 podcast, Dave Ferguson and Alan Hirsch speak on how the church is on the verge of some tremendous changes. Successful church leaders are using their existing forms and assets as platforms to launch more fluid, adaptive, and missional people-movements. On the Verge is based on the highly acclaimed book by Alan and Dave and will help you explore the insights of leaders who are launching new apostolic movements - and how your church can get involved.

item.title: Making Meaning with Vision: Five Questions for Leaders
item.description: After 10 years of coaching in the area of vision, Will Mancini has boiled down the top five questions that planters must wrestle through. Questions include: How am I running from or photocopying the ministry DNA of the church I am leave? Will my definition of success be limited by the metrics of yesterday? Will I choose to translate the culture well to the core team, or rely on my own talent? Don't miss the opportunity to lay the once-in-a-lifetime foundation of vision and culture for your church.

item.title: Best Practices in Spiritual Formation
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 workshop, Cally Parkinson helps you learn how top-ranked churches in "spiritual vitality" grow people into disciples of Christ. This intensive features five best practices uncovered when REVEAL investigated thew top 5% of its database of 1300 churches that have taken the REVEAL Spiritual Life Survey.You'll gain practical insights about actions that can be put in place immediately to help your people grow their relationship with Christ at a much faster pace and to a much deeper level. Whether you're early in the planting stages for launching a church, or you lead an existing church congregation, you'll come away from this experience feeling inspired, more focused, and better equipped to make sure the top priorities of you church are indeed producing spiritual growth.

item.title: Communication that Fosters Buy-in & Teamwork
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 workshop, Kem Meyer speaks on communication that fosters buy-in and teamwork. Do you ever notice your best ideas are met with lackluster reaction from those around you? having trouble leading change - even with the brightest people and best inventions? It's been said knowing how people grow does not mean we know how o grow them, and even in Kingdom work it's tricky learning how to work with others on the same team. discover a few ingredients for getting buy-in and motivating others we work with (staff, peers, supervisors, and volunteers).

item.title: Turnaround Churches
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 workshop, Bill Easum notes that it's not unusual for church plants to plateau and begin to decline. This workshop explains why and what to do to turn the church around and start it on the path to growth.

item.title: Church Planting Systems
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 workshop, Ed Stetzer speaks on church planting systems. Every single organism, including a single cell, requires a system to support life. Circulatory, respirator, and other systems make life possible. The same is true for a new church. New churches require systems that undergird the work of the body. Ed Stetzer will work through the needed new church systems to help church plants survive and thrive.

item.title: On the Verge of Discovering Who God Designed Me to Be
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 workshop, Lisa Jernigan poses the question, "Are you right there are the verge of discovery?" Perhaps you are in a rediscovery mode. Each of us has been individually designed on purpose for a purpose. Step inside this workshop, and outside your self and roles, and open your mind to understanding your unique heartbeat and dance and what that can look like. Let's start the dialogue about stirring our souls and living our life for Christ and walk away with an action plan. Not sure what that means? Then join us. Your purpose matters.

item.title: Are Churches Born to Reproduce?
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 workshop, John Worcester dares you to examine the Biblical evidence for a game-changing paradigm shift away from how most vies church planting in the USA today. Take a fresh look at the theology of Christ and the church from a church multiplication point of view. What if God had placed church reproduction into the very DNA of a church's nature? Explore practical ways churches, large and small, young and old, can become productively committed to the great commission we call "church planting."

item.title: Reworking Church Communications
item.description: In this Exponential 2011 workshop, Justin Wise elaborates on how one of the challenges of managing church communications is knowing when you need to change. With the fast paced culture of change we live in, being able and willing to change, and knowing when to change, is vital in staying connected with your audience. Oftentimes, conventional wisdom won't work. Sometimes you need to REWORK how you're communicating. Using principles and ideas from the New York Times Best-Seller REWORK (Jason Fried, David Heinemeier Hansson), this session will challenge you to rework your church communications to effectively adapt your message to reach your audience.

item.description: Exponential 2011 workshop with Dave Olson. Find out the most current statistics regarding the American Church. Where is the church declining and growing? item.title: Branding aMarketing 101: Primer for Church Planters
item.description: Exponential 2011 workshop with Patrick Dennis. Can a new or existing church raise awareness and shape how it is perceived by its community in a way that honors God? Yes! This session will provide practical advice in two awareness-building disciplines: Branding, letting people know what we are about, and Marketing, or "letting people know we are here." This seminar is for church planters/leaders who: (a) wrestle with whether or not their church should be involved in marketing efforts (whether on effectiveness or theological levels); or (b) want to do a better job of getting the word out and are not sure where to start. If you want to see your church expand its reach, and are aware that the potential impact of your church will be directly influenced by the degree to which people are aware you exist, this session is for you.

item.title: Why You Should Plant or Develop a Multi-Ethnic Church
item.description: Exponential 2011 workshop with Mark DeYmaz. Demographic shifts have brought change to America; and much more is on the way. Multi-ethnic church pioneers are not pursuing or promoting the vision simply because Rodney King once asked us all to get along; but rather because it is Biblical and right. In this workshop, Mark explores the New Testament moorings of the multi-ethnic church.

item.title: Missional Leadership: Living Out the Five Fold
item.description: Exponential 2011 workshop with JR Woodward. If the church is going to faithfully rebirth herself in the Western context and cultivate fruitful missional ethos, she must awaken the five equippers to live as cultural architects who awaken the entire community to join God in the renewal of all things. This workshop moves from theory to practice with a case example in Los Angeles.

item.title: Journeys to Significance: Learning from the Life of Paul
item.description: Exponential 2011 missional track workshop with Neil Cole. We are used to seeing Paul as teacher, but he is such a good teacher because he is first a good learner. In this workshop, Neil Cole follows Paul's example to see how he increased his significance and impact by doing less himself and empowering others to do more. Learn how entire regions, nations and ultimately the world were changed because Paul learned to equip others to do the work. Learn practical ways to pass the baton to others so that you can multiply your influence.
